see: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sZrhLlzER9nuEWmPSLbWcfsgH_0DlBI9QrGRBQdKRQg/edit#gid=0

field.name: entry_identifier
field.doc: Unique identifier for the experiment.

field.name: entry_identifier_uuid

field.name: scan_number
field.doc:
Scan number (must be an integer).
NOTE: Link to collection_identifier.

field.doc: Starting time of experiment, such as "2021-02-11 11:22:33.445566Z".

field.name: end_time

field.name: frame_sum

field.doc: TODO:

delay time, multitau

field.name: energy
field.doc: Incident beam line energy (either keV or eV).

field.name: description

field.name: distance
field.doc: Distance between sample and detector.

field.name: count_time
field.doc: Exposure time of frames, s

field.name: frame_time
field.doc: Exposure period (time between frame starts) of frames, s

field.name: beam_center_x
field.doc: Position of beam center, x axis, in detector's coordinates.

field.name: beam_center_y
field.doc: Position of beam center, y axis, in detector's coordinates.

field.name: x_pixel_size
field.doc: Length of pixel in x direction.

field.name: y_pixel_size

group.name: masks
group.doc:
Data masks could be defined using either NXarraymask or NXparameterizedmask.
Suggested name pattern: mask_1, mask_2, mask_3, ... Pick the next number in this sequence.
In the example file from 2020, masks are presented in a "masks:NXnote" subgroup (from now on, use the name pattern suggested above)::
masks:NXnote @NX_class = NXnote mask:NXarraymask @NX_class = NXarraymask data_link -> /entry/XPCS/data/g2 mask:NX_UINT32[516,1556] = __array __array = [ [27, 27, 27, '...', 27] [27, 27, 27, '...', 27] [27, 27, 27, '...', 27] ... [27, 27, 27, '...', 27] ] mask_names:NX_CHAR[9] = Q=0.002 usage:NX_CHAR = Selective

field.name: mask
field.doc:
ROI mask
The ``units`` attribute should be set to ``"au"`` indicating arbitrary units.

field.name: dqmap
field.doc:
ROI index array.
The values of this mask index the $Q$ value from the the ``dqlist`` field.
The ``units`` attribute should be set to ``"au"`` indicating arbitrary units.

field.name: dqlist
field.doc: 1-D list of $Q$ values, 1 for each ROI.

field.name: dphilist
field.doc: Array of $\varphi$ value for each pixel.

field.name: sqmap
field.doc:
ROI index array.
The values of this mask index the $|Q|$ value from the the ``sqlist`` field.
The ``units`` attribute should be set to ``"au"`` indicating arbitrary units.

field.name: sqlist
field.doc: 1-D list of $|Q|$ values, 1 for each ROI.

field.name: temperature_set
field.doc: Sample temperature setpoint, (C or K).

field.name: temperature
field.doc: Sample temperature actual, (C or K).

group.name: data
group.doc: Describes the default view. Link to datasets as needed.

group.name: ROI
group.doc:
Region(s) of interest.
NAME: The NeXus convention is to use all upper case to indicate the name (here ``ROI``) is left to the file writer. In our case, follow the suggested name pattern and sequence: roi_1, roi_2, roi_3, ... Start with ``roi_1`` if the first one, otherwise pick the next number in this sequence.

group.name: NOTE
group.doc:
Any other notes.
NAME: The NeXus convention is to use all upper case to indicate the name (here ``NOTE``) is left to the file writer. In our case, follow the suggested name pattern and sequence: note_1, note_2, note_3, ... Start with ``note_1`` if the first one, otherwise pick the next number in this sequence.
